chapter.title: Logging In to Knowledge
chapter.para: When the administrator creates an account for you, you will receive an email, which will contain login information (be sure to check your spam folder). If you do not receive an email with your account and login information, please contact your Knowledge Administrator.

section.title: User Roles
section.para:
A user is given at least one role and can also have more than one role in Knowledge. There are six roles in Knowledge:
Read : users with this role can view content
Editor: user's can modify content, create new content, search, classify, and export content
Content Manager: the Content Manager has all the capabilities of the Editor role, export content, and can release content
System Manager: the System Manager can has administrative privileges to manage users and their roles
Administrator: administrators can create user accounts, modify user accounts, edit content, create content, export content and release content
Automated: This is a role used for system to system communication

section.title: Login
section.para:
To login, enter your username (is not case sensitive) and password (is case sensitive). If Remember My Username is selected your username will be remembered the next time you login. If you forget your username or password select the appropriate link on the Knowledge Login screen and an email will be sent to you with your username or a link to reset your password. Login
Login Page
You have the options to log into Knowledge using a Google account or Microsoft 365 account as well. The account must be associated with the main login in order to work properly (visit your Profile Settings to update the e-mail address). If there is no account linked to the Google or Microsoft e-mail that is used, Knowledge will automatically create a new account and notify the administrator.

If you have difficulty logging in, selecting the "Can't log in?" link to reset your password. The system will lock the account after 5 failed attempts. At this point, contact the application administrator in order to unlock your account.

simplesect.title: Knowledge Homepage
simplesect.para: When you login into Knowledge you will see the Knowledge Manager Homepage as shown in .

From this page you can:
select the Profile menu option to change your profile information
add a user or modify a user's role if you are an Administrator
select the Go To Editor button to go to the Knowledge Editor
select the Go To API button to view the Rest API documentation
select the Go To Auth API button to view the Authentication API documentaiton
select the Logout button to logout of the application

section.title: Edit Profile
section.para:
Select the Profile menu option to change:
Display name
User name
Email address
Change password
To save changes select the Save button. Selecting the Cancel button will discard changes made. User Profile
